item.title: Zorro in the Court of England
item.description: Zorro in the Court of England is a 1969 Italian adventure film directed by Franco Montemurro.

item.title: Lola Colt
item.description: Lola Colt is a 1967 Spaghetti Western film directed by Siro Marcellini.

item.title: Hercules and the Treasure of the Incas
item.description: Hercules and the Treasure of the Incas is a 1964 film written and directed by Piero Pierotti and starring Alan Steel. Originally conceived as a peplum film, given the contemporary success of A Fistful of Dollars, it was turned into a western film during the shootings, resulting in a bizarre crossover between the two genres.

item.title: Johnny West il mancino
item.description: Left Handed Johnny West is a 1965 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Gianfranco Parolini.

item.title: Per 100.000 dollari ti ammazzo
item.description: Per 100.000 dollari ti ammazzo is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film. It represents the directorial debut film of Giovanni Fago. On the set of this film Gianni Garko got to know Susanna Martinkova, a Czechoslovakian actress at her debut in an Italian production, who little later married the actor and had a daughter with him.

item.title: Ten Thousand Dollars for a Massacre
item.description: 10.000 dollari per un massacro is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Romolo Guerrieri.

item.title: Vengeance Is My Forgiveness
item.description: Vengeance Is My Forgiveness is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Roberto Mauri.

item.title: Johnny Yuma
item.description: Johnny Yuma (1966) is a spaghetti western starring Mark Damon, Rosalba Neri, and Lawrence Dobkin. The title character earned his name by his exploits in a gunfight in Yuma, Arizona and has no relation to the 1961 The Rebel American television series.
